messages.message: who’s the go to person for the `lookup` function now? the function is written by someone who doesn’t work at IB anymore. compiling a flow with a refiner program using the `lookup` function onb a file also adds the file to the compiled binary and I want to understand this better as I need this for another refiner function. (maybe @Chetan? or @dlluncor think we spoke about this function before)
hey @Felicia, let’s bring in @Jonathan Shih here. Jonathan is working on a resources folder, and I’d encourage us to move to resources folder instead of the way that LOOKUP was written

alright, I actually just spoke to @Jonathan Shih about this as well. problem is that SC needs this to work (probably asap, not 100% on the timeline) otherwise they likely need to resort to writing a UDF to do almost the same thing as dataset tokenmatcher is doing.  cc @lydia and @Jesika Haria for input regarding the timeline we’re working with
gotcha. we could follow the LOOKUP model in that case. Happy to help if you need any help doing a replay of that code
@Felicia when you implemented the dataset tokenmatcher, I thought we had confirmed that it worked in a compiled flow binary. Is that not the case?
or has flow code changed since then?
@lydia I thought we had confirmed it but looking at the binary i compiled today and at the time, the dataset file isn’t included, just the file used in `lookup`
gotcha — for Flow Binary we’ll likely have to change the code to support dataset tokenmatcher — happy help with that pair programming @Felicia if you put some time on my calendar
So I assume this fix is going into the April release? @Nithin can you confirm that timeline works for you? @Felicia if you could create a Jira and tag it with the release, would be great!

@dlluncor would it work if we added it into the .flows/ib/custom folder like I did at jpmc and then passed the relative path to that folder to the tokenmatcher? or does tokenmatcher look in a specific folder? Also not sure if this would be a solution that SC would want to use.
(And @Felicia can we add this to the engineering UATs as well in the future? We want to continue to make sure that works)
Great point @Jonathan Shih, that would work if the Token matcher was written that way. I’m not sure if it is
Adding jonathan to the pair-programming session so we can all share state
@Jesika Haria This is currently blocking SC's Cash screening use case (high visible use case). The fix is required ASAP.
This use case is based off the march release?
thats right!

This is a pretty serious bug. What are our options for the fix? This involves putting it in, getting it UAT-ed and cherrypicking into the release branch. cc: @lydia @Felicia @Aaron Tami If the expectation was earlier set that SC would be able to use dataset TM for their use case based off the March release, we should lay out our available options
@Nithin if the options involve a workaround to add the dataset into the binary post-hoc, so that we can unblock their use case,  would that be feasible?
My #1 priority is to unblock the SC use case but since we’re so far the release cut, if they’re able to use the modified binary, that’d be great!

@Jesika Haria they have a logic in Apply UDF step which uses refiner output. From my high level analysis, its difficult to use post flow hook. Anyways I will check the feasibility and let you know by end of day.
FYI Flow: https://instabase.com/apps/flow/edit/ib_solutions/solutions/fs/Instabase%20Drive/poc/SC/Cash/workflow/cashFlow.ibflow#
Hmm idk if we need post-flow hook, I was thinking we can just unzip the binary, add the dataset in, and then re-zip it — wouldn’t that work?
I’m going to set up a meeting tomorrow between you, Lydia, and Felicia to discuss options for a workaround. Felicia is already going to work with David and Jonathan for a fix.
